text: Sir John Stainton Whitehead GCMG CVO (20 September 1932 â€“ 8 November 2013) is a British diplomat and businessman. "Whitehead, Sir John Stainton, GCMG., CVO., MA; BA," International Year Book and Statesmen's Who's Who including Who's Who in Public International Law; retrieved 2012-9-15. ==Career== Whitehead joined the British Foreign Service in 1955.Embassy of Japan in the UK, "The Japanese Government honours Sir John Whitehead," May 1, 2006; retrieved 2012-9-15. He was Ambassador from the United Kingdom to Japan (1986 - 1992). After his retirement from the diplomatic service, he was a senior advisor to Deutsche Bank, Tokyo Electric Power Company (TEPCO) and other international companies.Japaninvest Group, John Whitehead ; retrieved 2012-9-15. He became Chairman of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell Trust Bank (Japan). ==Honours== * Order of St Michael and St George, Knight Commander (KCMG) * Order of St Michael and St George, Knight Grand Cross (GCMB) * Royal Victorian Order, Commander (CVO) * Order of the Rising Sun, Grand Cordon, 2006 ==References== ==Other websites== * "(Nearly) meeting the Emperor" at Daiwa Foundation Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of St Michael and St George Category:Commanders of the Royal Victorian Order Category:1932 births Category:2013 deaths
